intro: Spermacoce sumatrensis, commonly known as the Sumatran sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Indonesia such as Sumatra and Java. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branched stems and opposite leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, round, dry fruits known as capsules. Spermacoce sumatrensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
